channel.title: Server from nothing. edited
channel.description: I build a 508 server and that server as nothing so i thought why not start a new project and build a server from nothing. So What i need to make it run? What i know. 1.Sockets(connections). 2.Few walking packets. Questions: In 508 source i can view the hp bar from the source? [b]WHEN ATTACKING NPC[/b] Edit: can someone tell me the hp bar java file?

item.title: Server from nothing. edited
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I know the clients inside out (mainly 317 junkies) and just understanding how the client sends out packets is really heavy stuff let alone understand the order packets are sent and how you intercept the data server sided.

I would highly recommend you learn how a basic server/client operates not looking a rsps prospective but generally in Java including how messages are sent only because I know you’re going to end up recreating another base out there because you’ll be referencing everything!

Read full topic

item.title: Server from nothing. edited
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

You need to know way more than sockets and a few packets to create a server.

No I phrased that wrong: you might know, but you probably don’t understand the key things it takes to crate a server. I’ve only made one server and I still don’t understand what it fully takes. Arham is a good and he doesn’t understand either. It takes a lot of time and research, trust me. Your going at this too early. Understand object orientation and inheiritance concepts and learn some basic concurrency then attempt it. I’m not trying to be a dick, I’m just giving my opinion on things. I’m not really involved with rsps anymore, but I do program from time to time so if you need help just drop a message.

Read full topic
